event: Earliest known settlements by Archaic Age hunter-gatherers on Antigua.
Saladoid people from South America settle on the islands, introducing agriculture and pottery.
Island inhabited by Arawak and later Carib peoples before European contact.
Christopher Columbus sights Antigua during his second voyage to the Americas.
British colonists from St. Kitts establish first European settlement on Antigua.
Britain formally takes control of Antigua following Treaty of Breda.
Sir Christopher Codrington establishes the first large-scale sugar plantation using enslaved Africans.
Slavery abolished throughout the British Empire, including Antigua and Barbuda.
Antigua and Barbuda administered as part of the British Leeward Islands colony.
Joins the West Indies Federation, a short-lived political union of British Caribbean colonies.
West Indies Federation dissolves; Antigua becomes a separate British colony.
Achieves associated statehood with full internal self-government.
Antigua and Barbuda gains full independence from the United Kingdom on November 1.
Hurricane Luis causes significant damage to infrastructure and housing.
United Progressive Party wins elections, ending nearly 30 years of rule by the Bird family and the Antigua Labour Party.
Hurricane Irma devastates Barbuda, forcing evacuation of the island’s entire population.
